title.narrative: 1.2.2.-PMTCT & PEADIATRIC AIDS PREVENTI

description.narrative: By 2016, at least 60% Class A and B health facilities have adequate capacity for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of children, youth and pregnant women and their partners infected / affected by HIV and AIDS in the 12 targeted prefectures and Bangui.(2012-2014) - By 2016, at least 80% Class A and B health facilities have adequate capacity for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of children, youth and pregnant women and their partners infected / affected by HIV and AIDS in the 13 targeted prefectures., which contributes to Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, 70% of girls and boys, young people and women of reproductive age, including those in emergency affected parts of the country, minority groups and the poorest quintile have access to knowledge, testing and treatment of HIV and AIDS.

sector.narrative: HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
Procurement and or supply management for HIV diagnostics and medicine

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, at least 60% Class A and B health facilities have adequate capacity for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment ofchildren, youth and pregnant women and their partners infected / affected by HIV and AIDS in the 12 targeted prefectures andBangui.(2012-2014) - By 2016, at least 80% Class A and B health facilities have adequate capacity for the prevention, diagnosisand treatment of children, youth and pregnant women and their partners infected / affected by HIV and AIDS in the 13 targetedprefectures.

description.narrative: 53% of districts with high HIV prevalence were strengthened to provide PMTCT services. 250 health workers and 200 community based organizations were trained on the new national B+ option guideline. 44 student peer educators, 44 schoolteachers were trained, 20 schools health club established and 36 health centers were revitalized. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: health facilities have adequate capacity for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of children, youth and pregnant women and their partners infected / affected by HIV and AIDS

actual.value: 2015:140 health facilities have adequate capacity for the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of children, youth and pregnant women and their partners infected / affected by HIV and AIDS.
